data.scheme_name: Kerala stressed MSMEs Revival & Rehabilitation scheme
data.benefits: Scheme provides grant assistance limited to Rs 2 lakhs.
data.eligibility: All MSME units are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
The applicant unit shall utilize the amount received as assistance only in the manner agreed upon.
The applicant units thus revived shall restart within one month of the date of receipt of financial assistance and shall be under obligation to function continuously for a further period of 5 years. 
Otherwise the assistance given shall be recovered under Kerala Revenue Recovery Act.
Unit must be a sick unit.
Units must have Udyam Registration.
data.beneficiaries: All MSME units are eligible under this scheme.

data.nodal_agency: District Industries Centre, Directorate of Industries and Commerce
data.context:
The scheme aims at reviving Micro, Small & Medium manufacturing enterprises which suffer due to stressed assets. The MSME units in the state suffer from various constraints such as lack of finance, problems in marketing and ineffective management practices and external factors, such as a general slowdown in demand, that cause sickness in firms.

 This scheme aims to revive micro, small and medium manufacturing enterprises in Kerala that suffer due to stressed assets. It will instill greater faith among entrepreneurs to undertake innovative projects in Kerala.
data.objective: The scheme intends to provide financial and other handholding support to the MSMEs which show signs of stress and to convert their non-productive assets into productive assets.
data.description:
Scheme provides grant assistance limited to Rs 2 lakhs for restructuring of existing loan account.
Interest subvention of 6% per annum subject to a maximum amount of Rs 1 lakh for restructuring of existing loan account.
For restart expenses: 
Assistance for Additional/Balancing Plant & Machinery: 50% of the cost for new additional/balancing plant & machinery, if no term loan is availed	, upto Rs 1.50 lakhs (one-time)
Assistance for Repair & Maintenance: 50% of the cost incurred for repair and maintenance of existing plant, machinery, and building, upto Rs.1 lakhs.
data.how_to_apply: The applicant can apply through the link: https://schemes.industry.kerala.gov.in/public/index.php/schemes
data.funding_facilitator: General Manager, District Level Rehabilitation Committee, District Industries Centre
data.funding_mechanism:
1. 50% of the 6% interest subsidy shall be released within 60 days from the date of release of the loan from financial institution/bank. The second installment ie. balance 50% of interest subsidy eligible for the 1st year shall be paid after the completion of 12 months period of successful running of the unit and shall be based on a report from the concerned financial institution/bank with regard to the performance of the unit. The interest subvention amount shall be released to the loan account of the unit. 

2. Other assistance shall be released to the applicant by the General Manager after executing agreement in stamp paper by the applicant.
